summary: Tidal player that saved my life

description:
Handles Organized Music Collections Well

I've got a large collection of music (50+Gigs) already organized in folders organized by group/artist and album. Strawberry read the entire structure in a very short amount of time. And (first big win), it shows me that structures and, generally, recognizes album art (seemingly either embedded in the mp3s or loose in the same golder). The one significant flaw is that I can't just play an album. I still have to create a play list. And in a universe of music players that just displays a scrolling list of songs and often don't offer a way to sort the columns, it's major progress

Controls

All the key controls (play, pause, next/previous track and volume) are right at hand. I never realized how important it was to have a volume control that showed the volume level was until I moved into a place where the neighbors are through paper-thin walls. I like my neighbors and they like us. We don't tend to agree on music.

Niftiness

* Display song lyrics (from AudD on the songs I tested).
* Handles old tech: plays CDs
 and Transcode/rip music to a bunch of formats including FLAC, AAC and mp3 (untested)
* Supports Scrobblers via LastFM and LibreFM
* Streams vis Tidal, Qobuz, Subsonic

Player that focuses on great sound quality with an easy to use and simple interface. Combined with Tidal music streaming you have a serious high quality streaming interface. As a plus it has excellent output flexibility and driver support. No driver issues at all with my Khadas tone board.
thanks for the excelent job! thanks in advance!
summary: i couldn't stream TIDAL's master till now

description: The interface is excellent, both functionally and aesthetically. Handles my library (60000+ files) with no drain of resources (I'm using a tiny netbook with an atom processor and 2 gig memory). Capable of outputting directly to alsa, which is best for my SB X-Fi usb sound. Only improvement I can think of is having a tree view in the file window. Terrific product!
Other than the tidal issue, a fine music player.
excelent good job
Is similar to Clementine but including lyrics but without radio
summary: Perfect for listening while reading lyrics

description: Slow to load with a UI that looks like it was developed 30 years ago. It struggles with network shares and can't access some local folders.

Not the best interface (My favorite is MusicBee, unavailaible on linux) but does the job at managing a complete collection, finding lyrics etc. 

Tried all the players, this is the best one as of 2020.
i love it it works great
summary: i love it it works great app would recommend

description:
Este fork, además del nuevo ícono, no solo no aporta absolutamente nada al mundo de los reproductores de música, sino que quita algunas de las funciones de Clementine como visualizar la información de la canción, la posibilidad de conectarse a servicios de streaming o radios online. Además, se siente más inestable que Clementine y se ve exactamente igual (salvo por la fresa) .

Quizas en futuras versiones mejore, pero por ahora no vale la pena abandonar a la naranja
5 Estrellasssss

обновилось ядро. Обновил программу вручную с оффициального сайта. Поставил набор пульс-эффект. Слушаю в кононках с эквалайзером программы. В колонке JBL включаю Пульс-аудио эквалайзер. Все супер. Как а классной системы. В ценрах приложений Убуну этого нет. Ищите в сети. Комп старый. Удачи.
